newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Gays should have own "love motels" - Argentine mayor.
newsitem.headline: Gays should have own "love motels" - Argentine mayor.

text.p: Buenos Aires' mayor suggested on Friday that gays who want to use pay-by-the-hour "love" lodges scattered throughout the Argentine capital should have their own special hotels and rejected a proposal that would permit gay people to use the popular facilities.

"There may be exclusive hotels for these situations," Mayor Fernando de la Rua told reporters, rejecting a move by the centre-left Frepaso party to allow homosexuals to use the love motels. "It's a crazy idea," he said. "It's the world gone topsy-turvy."
Love motels, a tradition in Argentina, are popular with young couples who still live at home, men with prostitutes and people cheating on their partners.

"I respect everyone, their equality, rights and freedom, but there are certain rules of living which exist for a reason," the Radical Party mayor said. "Allowing gays into love motels may create big dangers ... how can you tell they're not just two assailants?"

Under a 1980 city ordinance a pay-by-the-hour hotel is defined as "an establishment where such services are provided for periods shorter than 24 hours, without including food, to couples of different sex who are given furniture, bed sheets and toiletries."
